vocabulary.english: you (ang-form, singular, at start of phrase)

contents.markdown: If you do not know it already, please go to **Appendix A** and memorize ang form pronoun _ikaw_ before attempting this lesson.

item.tagalog: Kumain si David ng halo-halo.

contents.markdown: The focus is David. David is in the middle of the Tagalog sentence, which is normal. But it is also possible to express the same thing by “inverting” the sentence to make the focus come first. This lesson is about sentences created using the _ay_ inversion, which I call _ay_ sentences for short. They may sound a bit bookish or formal to native speakers, but they are not uncommon.

Warning – Your goal should be to recognize and understand these when you encounter them, but I recommend that you do not use these in colloquial speech for the time being. You will not be wrong or misunderstood if you do, but you will not be talking like a native if you frequently use these. And because native English speakers often find these easier to produce due to their English-like subject-predicate structure, there is a great temptation to do just that. So, to discourage that habit I will limit their use to this lesson.
_Ay_ sentences are formed the same as non-_ay_ sentences, except you put the focus first, followed by _ay_, then the remainder of the sentence:
Ay Sentence. = Focus + ay + (sentence without focus).

item.tagalog: Subject is Predicate Ex: Pagkain ang adobo.
Ay sentence: Ang adobo ay pagkain.
Subject is Adjective Ex: Puti ang mga sasakyan.
Ay sentence: Ang mga sasakyan ay puti.
To Like a Noun in General Ex: Mahilig sila sa tsokolate.
Ay sentence: Sila ay mahilig sa tsokolate.
AF Standard Sentence Ex: Kumain si David ng halo-halo.
Ay sentence: Si David ay kumain ng halo-halo.
Neg AF Standard Sentence Ex: Hindi kumain si David ng halo-halo.
Ay sentence: Si David ay hindi kumain ng halo-halo.

contents.markdown: These are structures that you have already learned, inverted with _ay_. Notice that, except for the _ay_, the _ay_ sentence word order is the same as English. That is why they are tempting to use for native English speakers. However, in addition to not being as common, many _ay_ structures do not use English word order:

item.tagalog: OF Standard Sentence Ex: Gagawin niya ang adobo.
Ay sentence: Ang adobo ay gagawin niya.
IOF Standard Sentence Ex: Binibigyan ni Angel ng mangga ang guro.
item.english: Angel is giving the teacher a mango.

item.tagalog: Ay sentence: Ang guro ay binibigyan ni Angel ng mangga.
item.english: Angel is giving the teacher a mango.

item.tagalog: Neg OF Standard Sentence Ex: Hindi niya gagawin ang adobo.
item.english: She will not make the adobo.

item.tagalog: Ay sentence: Ang adobo ay hindi niya gagawin.
item.english: She will not make the adobo.

item.tagalog: Neg IOF Standard Sentence Ex: Hindi binibigyan ni Angel ng mangga ang guro.
item.english: Angel is not giving the teacher a mango.

item.tagalog: Ay sentence: Ex: Ang guro ay hindi binibigyan ni Angel ng mangga.
item.english: Angel is not giving the teacher a mango.

item.tagalog: To Want/Like a Specific Object Ex: Gusto ni Joe ang bahay na yun.
Ay sentence: Ang bahay na yun ay gusto ni Joe.
Who is Verb Sentence Ex: Sino ang nagluto ng adobo?
Ay sentence: Ang nagluto ng adobo ay sino?
What is Verb Sentence Ex: Ano ang hahanapin ni Joshua?
Ay sentence: Ang hahanapin ni Joshua ay ano?

contents.markdown: Although this is just a sample of _ay_ sentences, it should be enough so that when you hear new ones in the wild you will be able to understand them.
<u>Ikaw is used instead of ka at the beginning of sentences.</u>
_Ikaw_ is the singular ang form of “you” which must be used at the beginning of _ay_-sentences.

item.tagalog: Ikaw po ay maganda.
Ikaw ba ay mahilig sa adobo?
Ikaw ay kumain ng halo-halo ko!

contents.markdown: Notice that _ikaw_ is a host, but not enclitic itself.
Normally, you can contract ay to _’y _if the preceding word ends in a vowel,_ n _or_ w _(_’y _replaces the_ n _or_ w_).

item.tagalog: Ang babae ay maganda.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ikaw rin ba ay mahilig sa halo-halo?
Si Jessica ay hindi magbibigay ng mga baso sa kanila bukas.
